data.title: Simply the best true french hospitality and awsome food.
data.text:
Friends of our's who are restaurant owners recommended  us this fantastic  real version of  a Parisien  bistro,the décor is simple but warm. What makes small Parisien bistro  an experience in Paris is that you will find the chef (owner) at the bar,in the kitchen ,and most important at your table.
Chef Laurent personally guided us trough its rich but simple menu that include La Potence (fondue  flambee)  and the magnificient  Raclette  (cheese fondue) way to eat almost unknown to most American.
I don't have to tell you  that everything was not only delicious but also spectacular.
They have a wonderful wine list  at the right price .Dessert was straight from heaven.
Chef Laurent's daughter Valentine who was our server that evening never hesitate to take time to guided us trough our first experience there. I recommend this place to all food&wine lovers . We will sure become regulars to La Flambee.

data.title: If you don't have a reservation prepare to be treated like garbage!
data.text:
Drove 45 minutes from Miami specifically for this restaurant. Arrived at 9:00 pm and was rudely told by hostess" No. We're full" no greeting, no wait time, no explanation that reservations would be a good idea for the weekend just told us they were full and walked away. 
Didn't bother staying. S.O was very turned off by smell in the establishment as well. Very disappointing experience was really looking forward to trying their raclette.

data.title: Great Local surprise
data.text: Found La flambee by accident and it was a pleasent surprise,   great service and the food was awesome.

data.title: Great Local surprise
data.text: Found La Flambee by accident and it was a very nice surprise.  Great service and the food was wonderful.

data.title: Delicious dinner!
data.text: I thought I'd died and gone to heaven!  Everything was so delicious!  Run by a friendly couple from France, who told us they also have a restaurant in Monmartre. They gave us a complimentary pâté plate, and we ordered cheese fondue and steak with béarnaise sauce, then strawberry tart and chocolate mousse for dessert. Everything was magnifique!  I can't wait to go back. Oh--also had a very nice glass of Pinot Noir, and herbal tea. I was sad that the restaurant was not well attended the mid-week night we went. I really hope they get a name for themselves so that I can go there every time I'm down from New York, and/or that they open a restaurant in New York!

data.title: Fresh greens with ample smoked Salmon
data.text:
Made for this unexpected luncheon a memorable delight.
The chef/owner cheerfully greeted us upon arrival, his gracious, beautiful wife navigated us through this most French menu...
The family 
New to this country, bringing with them the best of Parisian delights How fortunate we are here in Hollywood to benefit from their offerings of true French cuisine...
Thank you for making our day perfectly wonderful...,

data.title: Lovely relaxed evening meal.
data.text: Four of us ate there Saturday night, for the first time, on the recommendation of a friend. The food was delicious, especially the onion soup and the duck. Service was friendly and efficient, attentive but not overbearing. The food was well prepared and beautifully presented.  Prices were reasonable. The desserts were great. We will definitely return.

data.title: Nice French restaurant with reasonable prices
data.text:
We would highly recommend La Flambee. Open only since October 2015, it is owned and operated by a French immigrant couple from Paris; husband cooks and wife serves as hostess, waitstaff etc.
The menu is modest in terms of number of items; a good sign because it probably means everything is cooked to order. Indeed that was our experience as we were told that one of the items that we ordered takes a long time to took - Racliflette was definitely worth the wait. Restaurant also serves fondue and several desert crepes. They offer a decent wine selection and keep the prices by offering wine from different parts of the world such as Chile. We would be happy to return to  La Flambee.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: To say the truth i love french restourants but this is my favorite. The food was excellent and i recomend the meat fondue and as the desert ill recomend  crepe zussete

data.title: Restaurant familial Français
data.text: Petit Resto  français qui ne paie pas de mine ,mais où il faut pousser la porte, pourra être accueilli par la maman et la fille le fils est le papa étant à la cuisine. Spécialités françaises incroyables à Miami, genre tartiflette, fondue savoyarde, fondue bourguignonne raclette, pierrade, bœuf bourguignon , foie gras maison ,ainsi que d'excellents desserts .petit bémol, on attend quand même beaucoup si il y a du monde, mais ça vous le coup...

data.title: superbe endroit Francais et sympathique
data.text: Il y a longtemps que je n ai pas retrouve des saveurs française je veux dire des vrais...c était un grand plaisir , les profiteroles sont a tombées elles sont faites maison avec du bon chocolat et non du topping ... et la cerise sur le gateau c est l accueil , Laurent et Fazia sont des personnes super sympathiques et commerçants et je leur souhaite une grande réussite
